title: 'It's beyond inappropriate': Kmart pulls kids costume after mum's petition
text:
"They have a social responsibility to pull this item off their shelves immediately!"

Aussie retailers are feeling the pinch as mass closures and job losses are on the horizon.

Shannon felt so appalled when she saw a child’s costume on the shelves at Kmart that she started a change.org petition.

People launch petitions all the time with some making very little waves - while others can gain a lot of traction and eventually does create change.

But few petitions would have had such an impressive outcome within just two days like this Melbourne mum’s one did.

Kmart immediately stood up and listened by pulling the “offensive” product from their shelves on Tuesday afternoon.

The $6 costume in question is a white wedding gown and headband with a veil made for children between the ages of 4 and 6.

“Kmart Australia regrets the decision to range the bride costume,” a Kmart spokesperson told 7 News.

The $6 bride costume, for children aged between 4 and 6, has been pulled from Kmart's shelves.

"They have a social responsibility to pull this item off their shelves immediately"

“It was not intended to cause offence and we sincerely apologise. We have made the decision to withdraw this product.”

Shannon didn’t hold back with her words when asking people to sign the petition that only garnered 191 signatures.

“Tell Kmart this is beyond inappropriate and offensive and that they have a social responsibility to pull this item off their shelves immediately. Please help me get this message to Kmart by signing this petition,” she said.

“Each year, 12 million children (girls as young as 6 years old - the same size as this “costume”) are sold or married off by their family without their consent."

"That’s one million child marriages per month!"

“That equates to 23 children every minute or 1 child every 2 minutes. If this continues, 150 million more children will be married by the year 2030.

“Child marriage means child abuse and torture in its worst forms - paedophilia, child rape, child slavery, child sex trafficking. Kmart -Take this child bride costume off your shelves.”

It just goes to show – don’t ever think the smallest action can’t make a difference!
description: "They have a social responsibility to pull this item off their shelves immediately!"
